rev.comment: /* Resources */ putting sources back - 30 KB is NOT too large for an article!

rv; no it doesn't, it clearly indicates that it was a former PM
No it is irrelevant. Ecevit apologised and retracted that statement shortly afterwards, this article is skewing his diplomatic mistake as being representative of the Turkish government
needed tidying up, though I do wonder how that section is relevant - could be better worded still
What ministers, primje ministers and presidents believe IS relevent in such section, they ARE part of the government.
The section is entitled "Turkish government position" therefore that is exactly what we include. Individual statements do not represent the policy of governments.
rv. to last btm, what a Turkish president, pm or minister think is relevant in that section.
/* The Position of Turkish Government */ A former PM and 'leading' lawmakers statements do not represent the position of the Turkish government
/* The Position of Turkish Government */ cp
